Not sure I agree with 'the best we can do is', eg keras has a parameter 'reset_after', that defaults to v3, but can be set to v1, for cudnn compatibility, https://keras.io/layers/recurrent/ . I do agree though that documenting which version is being used is probably largely sufficient for now, especially since choosing v3 breaks cudnn compatibility.

body:
Not sure I agree with 'the best we can do is', eg keras has a parameter
'reset_after', that defaults to v3, but can be set to v1, for cudnn
compatibility, https://keras.io/layers/recurrent/ . I do agree though that
documenting which version is being used is probably largely sufficient for
now, especially since choosing v3 breaks cudnn compatibility.
